Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a violation of freedom of speech.
The bill is perceived as government overreach and likened to communism or dictatorship.
There is a distrust in government efforts to regulate misinformation, citing historical instances where unpopular ideas were later proven true.
The exclusion of government-authorised content from censorship is viewed as creating a double standard.
The submission calls for empowering individuals through education and critical thinking rather than legislative control.
Notable Quotes: The Government has absolutely no right to present such a communistic amendment to the parliament!
This bill tramples on freedom of speech, It compels big tech to silence discussion...
Why is this government initiating this now? Why would an honest and honorable parliament... seek to legislate that power away from us?
This is government overreach, reeks of communism and the murmurings of a dictatorship.
